	<meta property="og:title" content="Customer Loyalty Programs Hold Formidable Value in American Purchasing Decisions" />
	<meta property="og:description" content="Customer loyalty programs are nothing new, but do they work? And how much value do they create?  Recent CivicScience data show that over a fifth of U.S. adults say customer loyalty programs are ‘very’ important to them in choosing where to shop and what brands to buy, while one-third report they’re ‘not at all’ important. [...]Read More... from Customer Loyalty Programs Hold Formidable Value in American Purchasing Decisions" />

<link rel="alternate" type="text/xml+oembed" href="https://civicscience.com/wp-json/oembed/1.0/embed?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcivicscience.com%2Fcustomer-loyalty-programs-hold-formidable-value-in-american-purchasing-decisions%2F&format=xml" />
<!-- start Simple Custom CSS and JS -->
<script>
/* Default comment here */ 

jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
	jQuery('.search-box').keydown(function(event){
		if(event.keyCode == 13) {
			event.preventDefault();
			return false;
		}
	});
	
	$('#advertising-case .case-study-intro a').on('click',function(e){
		e.preventDefault();
		$('#advertising-case .case-accordion').stop().slideToggle(200,function(){
			$('html, body').animate({
				scrollTop: $('#advertising-case .case-accordion .container').offset().top - 200
			}, 500);
		});
	});

	$('#advertising-case .case-content .closebtn').on('click',function(e){
		e.preventDefault();
		$('#advertising-case .case-accordion').stop().slideToggle(200,function(){
			$('html, body').animate({
				scrollTop: $('#advertising-case .case-study-intro').offset().top
			}, 500);
		});
	});
	
	$('.purchase-report-now').on('click', function(){
		if($('body').hasClass('postid-40971')) {
			window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 14986836 });
		}
		if($('body').hasClass('postid-41233')) {
			window.lintrk('track', { conversion_id: 14916708 });
		}
	});
	
	$('#advertising-solve .solve-box').matchHeight();
	$('#home-offerings .promo h3').matchHeight();
	$('#home-offerings .promo').matchHeight();
	$('#home-offerings .promo-text p').matchHeight();
	$('.insight-text h2').matchHeight();

	$('#pmpro_form .pmpro_checkout-field .pmpro_required').prop('required',true);

	$('.parent-button > a').on('click',function(e){
		e.preventDefault();
		$('.parent-button .child-button').stop().slideToggle();
	});

	$(window).on('load',function(){
		if($('.leadership-team-carousel').length) {
			$('.leadership-team-carousel').slick({
				slidesToScroll: 1,
				arrows: true,
				prevArrow: $('.member-prev'),
				nextArrow: $('.member-next'),
				slidesToShow: 3,
				centerPadding: '80px',
				variableWidth: true,
			});
			$('#about-leadership-team .slide-wrapper').addClass('loaded');
		}
	});
	
	$('#wws-section .testimonial-box').matchHeight();

});
</script>

<style>
.home .header-area.royal-blue {
	background-color: transparent;
}

.page-template-template-request-demo .header-area.royal-blue {
	background: transparent !important;
}

.page-template-template-request-demo .header-area.royal-blue.scrolling {
	background: #FFFFFF !important;
}

.page-template-template-request-demo .header-area.royal-blue .navbar ul li a[title="Request a Demo"] {
	display: none;
}

.page-template-template-request-demo .header-area.royal-blue .navbar ul #menu-item-14, .page-template-template-request-demo .header-area.royal-blue .navbar ul #menu-item-20 {
	display: none;
}

.page-template-template-request-demo section.request-a-demo, .home section.hero-new {
	margin-top:-100px;
}

@media(min-width:990px) {
	.home .header-area.royal-blue {
		background-color: transparent;
	}
	.home section.hero-new {
		margin-top: -100px;
	}
}

.header-area.scrolling, .header-area.white {
	background: #FFFFFF !important;
}

section.hero-new {
	min-height: 100vh;
}

@media (min-width: 992px) {
	section.hero-new {
		position: relative;
		margin-bottom: -8px;
		height: auto;
	}

#caf-filter-layout2 {
	margin-bottom: 20px;
}
#caf-filter-layout2.caf-filter-layout.srch-on.search-layout1 ul.dropdown {
	padding: 0 !important;

}

	border-radius: 50px;

}
#caf-filter-layout2 .caf-search-bar #caf-search-input {

}
#caf-filter-layout2 .caf-search-bar #caf-search-sub {

}

#caf-filter-layout2 .caf-filter-container .dropdown > li.activss {

}

}
.caf-filter-container ul,
.caf-filter-container .caf-search-bar {

.caf-filter-container ul.dropdown > li {

}
.caf-filter-container ul li a {

}

.caf-filter-container ul li a i {

}
.caf-filter-container ul li > a.active {

}
.caf-filter-container ul li:hover > a {

}
.caf-filter-container ul li span {

	padding: 0 !important;

}
.caf-filter-container ul li .arrow-down,
.caf-filter-container ul li .arrow-up {

<div class="post-header-area" style="background-image: url(https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/medium-shot-women-scanning-qr-code-scaled.jpg);">
	<div class="container">
		<div class="row">
			<div class="col-md-8">
				<div class="post-header">
					<ul class="post-tag">

					<h1>Customer Loyalty Programs Hold Formidable Value in American Purchasing Decisions</h1>
					
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="copyright">
                    Image Credit: <a class="button" style="color: white" href="https://www.freepik.com/free-photo/medium-shot-women-scanning-qr-code_23494103.htm#query=loyalty%20program&position=1&from_view=keyword&track=ais&uuid=52ec8de1-be66-4cf9-b1bd-d4fd18648be9" target="_blank">Image via Freepik</a>
        	</div>
</div> 

<div class="post-area">
        <div class="container">
            <div class="row">
                <div class="col-lg-9">
                    <div class="post-meta">
                        <ul class="align-items-center">
							                            <li class="mr-2 d-flex align-items-center"><span class="author rounded-circle mr-2 overflow-hidden"><img width="30" src="https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/699c148fa17395ead0416053b255e87e?s=96&d=mm&r=g" alt=""></span>Andrew Gallant</li>
                            <li><a href="mailto:agallant@civicscience.com">agallant@civicscience.com</a></li>
							                            <li>Published: February 14, 2024</li>
                        </ul>
                        <div class="share">
                            <h5>Share</h5>
                            <ul>
                                <li><a href="http://twitter.com/share?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcivicscience.com%2Fcustomer-loyalty-programs-hold-formidable-value-in-american-purchasing-decisions%2F" target="_blank"><i class="fab fa-twitter"></i></a></li>
                                <li><a href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fcivicscience.com%2Fcustomer-loyalty-programs-hold-formidable-value-in-american-purchasing-decisions%2F" target="_blank"><i class="fab fa-facebook-f"></i></a></li>
                              
                                <li><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcivicscience.com%2Fcustomer-loyalty-programs-hold-formidable-value-in-american-purchasing-decisions%2F" target="_blank"><i class="fab fa-linkedin-in"></i></a></li>
                            </ul>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="post-content">
						
<p>Customer loyalty programs are nothing new, but do they work? And how much value do they create? </p>



<p>Recent CivicScience data show that over a fifth of U.S. adults say customer loyalty programs are ‘very’ important to them in choosing where to shop and what brands to buy, while one-third report they’re ‘not at all’ important. Additionally, 66% of consumers who place the highest importance on loyalty programs say they are ‘very’ loyal to their favorite brands. </p>



<p>Where can you find these consumers who especially value loyalty programs? Recent polling data show you may find them shopping online – more than half of respondents who highly value customer loyalty programs are shopping online more than they typically would around this time last year.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full"><img fetchpriority="high" decoding="async" width="966" height="670" src="https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-1.png" alt="" class="wp-image-42159" srcset="https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-1.png 966w, https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-1-300x208.png 300w, https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-1-768x533.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 966px) 100vw, 966px" /></figure>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>



<p><strong>Take Our Poll: </strong><a href="https://www.civicscience.com/civicscience-polls/Polls?civicscience-widget-question=424765" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"><strong>Do you belong to any loyalty programs for stores, airlines, hotels, or other companies that you pay a monthly or annual fee for?</strong></a></p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="h-the-majority-of-americans-prefer-free-loyalty-programs-except-democrats">The majority of Americans prefer free loyalty programs, except Democrats.</h3>



<p>The top type of loyalty program among Americans is free memberships where users can earn points – a method favored by as much as two-thirds of Americans. However, loyalty program users who pay a recurring fee for larger discounts are most likely to be ‘very loyal’ to their favorite brands.</p>



<p>Loyalty program preferences differ by political affiliation. For instance, while 77% of Republicans and 70% of independents are most likely to also say they like free programs, Democrats (48%) are far less likely to agree. A slim majority of Democrats are more likely to use paid loyalty programs, including programs requiring either a one-time membership fee for smaller discounts on all future purchases (23%), a one-time fee for larger discounts on a set number of purchases (15%), or a recurring membership fee that grants them larger discounts on all future purchases (13%).</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-full is-resized"><img decoding="async" width="983" height="682" src="https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-2.png" alt="" class="wp-image-42160" style="width:840px;height:auto" srcset="https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-2.png 983w, https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-2-300x208.png 300w, https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-2-768x533.png 768w" sizes="(max-width: 983px) 100vw, 983px" /></figure>



<p>Want to see more insights exploring how political affiliation affects consumer well-being, financial outlook, and spending plans as the 2024 presidential election fast approaches? Click <a href="https://info.civicscience.com/consumer-mindset-2024-election-tracker?utm_campaign=Marketing%20LPs%20and%20Demo&utm_source=Content%3A%2002_14_2024%3A%20Loyalty%20Programs%20Election%20Tracker%20LP&utm_medium=News%20%2B%20Insights" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">here</a> to see how the <strong>CivicScience 2024 Election Mindset Tracker </strong>can help you stay one step ahead. </p>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="h-consumers-love-rewards-programs-offering-free-shipping-and-discounts-the-most">Consumers love rewards programs offering free shipping and discounts the most.</h3>



<p>What loyalty program perks are most enticing to consumers? Additional polling showed free shipping (much like <a href="https://civicscience.com/holiday-shoppers-seek-convenience-free-shipping-when-shopping-online-this-year/#:~:text=In%20Guiding%20Where,next%20closest%20consideration" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">online holiday shoppers</a>), the ability to earn larger discounts, and gaining small discounts on everyday purchases were the clear top three among U.S. adults, including across each age group. That said, Gen Z adults are more likely than others to look for exclusive access to limited edition products, and Millennials are more keen on VIP events or experiences.</p>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img decoding="async" width="1024" height="478" src="https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-3-1-1024x478.png" alt="" class="wp-image-42163" srcset="https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-3-1-1024x478.png 1024w, https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-3-1-300x140.png 300w, https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-3-1-768x358.png 768w, https://civicscience.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/loyalty-programs-2024-3-1.png 1430w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<h3 class="wp-block-heading" id="h-three-insights-about-consumers-who-highly-value-customer-loyalty-programs">Three Insights About Consumers Who Highly Value Customer Loyalty Programs:</h3>



<ul>
<li>Those who consider customer loyalty programs to be ‘very important’ are more than three times as likely to say TV advertising influences their purchase decisions at least ‘a little.’</li>



<li>They’re far more likely to expect their credit score to go up in the next six months.</li>



<li>When asked why they’re loyal to their favorite brands, 6-in-10 cited ‘quality.’ They’re also more than four times as likely to list ‘service’ compared to those who say loyalty programs are not important to them. </li>
</ul>



<p>Although economic headwinds have forced some brands to <a href="https://www.qsrmagazine.com/operations/outside-insights/why-are-some-restaurant-brands-cutting-back-on-rewards/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">scale back</a> their loyalty programs, it comes at the risk of alienating loyal customers. It’s clear that many Americans place at least some level of importance on loyalty programs when making purchasing decisions. Tailored rewards perks and, in some cases, paid programs could offer a possible way forward as brands fight to maintain customer bases in a tougher economic environment. </p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity"/>
